intro: Mosiera contrerasii, commonly known as the Contreras' mosiera, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine layer of hairs, which helps reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Mosiera contrerasii is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
